thread.title: Porto player Hector Herrera's foot has seen better days
thread.title_full: Porto player Hector Herrera's foot has seen better days

author: Sean Gibson
title: Porto player Hector Herrera's foot has seen better days
text:
Porto player Hector Herrera's foot has seen better days Herrera suffered a nasty foot injury on Wednesday night Sean Gibson  01pm 
F C Porto's Hector Herrera has posted a grim image online of the injury he sustained in Wednesday night's Champions League match against Juventus. 
The Mexican midfielder was clearing the ball out of his own box when he was caught painfully by Juve's Stephen Lichtsteiner - who was booked for the challenge. 
Lichtsteiner's blades came downwards as Herrera's boot swept up, through the ball; the result was a couple of horrific-looking gashes and significant swelling on the top of the 26-year-old's left foot. Porto's Hector Herrera jumps above Sami Khedira in Porto's first-leg home defeat to Juventus Credit: JOSE COELHO/EPA 
A mazingly, Herrera saw out the full 90 minutes, despite being hobbled by Lichtsteiner in the 50 th minute of the game. 
Juve won 2-0 in the first leg of their round-of-16 tie with Porto, nabbing two away goals in the second half after Porto's Alex Telles was dismissed in the first period for two bookable offences.
